alert.note: Alert for Central Yampa River Basin; Elkhead and Park Mountains; Lower Yampa River Basin (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 02 at 12:15AM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Routt and northeastern Moffat Counties through 1245 AM MDT... At 1214 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 42 miles southwest of Dad to 27 miles southwest of Dixon to 17 miles south of Baggs. Movement was northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Powder Wash, Slater and Fortification. This includes Colorado 13 between mile markers 110 and 127. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Central Yampa River Basin; Elkhead and Park Mountains; Lower Yampa River Basin
